intro: Terminalia sericea var. angolensis, commonly known as the Angolan satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in dry savannas and woodlands, where it plays a role in local ecosystems. Due to its ornamental value and timber quality, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
